cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 miles SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the middle and upper Texas coast, with the center projected to approach the coast late Friday and then linger inland over southeast Texas through the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O'Connor–Corpus Christi area

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch (also under Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from north of San Luis Pass to High Island; Storm Surge Watch from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds possible (34-kt probability up to 41% and 50-kt probability up to 12%) with earliest onset early Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–6 ft above ground possible from Port Mansfield to High Island, including Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated 20 inches possible, producing life-threatening flooding around Galveston and southeast Texas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents; prolonged flooding of roads and port facilities due to slow storm movement.
